title.narrative: 1.2.1 : HIV ADVOCACY& POLICY

description.narrative: By 2016, the necessary strategic and policy documents have been developped and the HIV/AIDS multi-sectoral response is coordinated, implemented monitored and evaluated.(2012-2014) By 2016, the CNLS and key stakeholders in the fight against HIV and AIDS have developed the necessary strategic and policy documents and coordinate, monitor and evaluate the multi-sectoral response., which contributes to Hiv â€“ General, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, 70% of girls and boys, young people and women of reproductive age, including those in emergency affected parts of the country, minority groups and the poorest quintile have access to knowledge, testing and treatment of HIV and AIDS.

sector.narrative: HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, the necessary strategic and policy documents have been developped and the HIV/AIDS multi-sectoral response iscoordinated, implemented monitored and evaluated.(2012-2014) By 2016, the CNLS and key stakeholders in the fight against HIV andAIDS have developed the necessary strategic and policy documents and coordinate, monitor and evaluate the multi-sectoral response.

description.narrative: Various strategic documents were developed: Paediatric and Adolescent HIV scale up plan, the Global Fund 2018-2020 HIV/AID/TB/ proposal, the task-shifting policy and the revision of the national ART guideline among others. Advocacy meeting for resource mobilization held with parliamentarian. The HIV/AID coordination body was strengthened to undertake joint activities | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: of coordination structures strengthened and functional

actual.value: 2015:3 coordination structures strengthened and made functional (CCM. AIDS council, National AIDS control Programme)

title.narrative: of national strategic plans on HIV revised

actual.value: 2015:One national strategic plan on HIV was revised and the elaboration beyond Concept Note was submitted to the Global Fund's outstanding submission,
